memberdef.name: Primitive

memberdef.definition: using CGAL::Shape_detection::Point_set::Least_squares_sphere_fit_region< GeomTraits, Item_, PointMap, NormalMap >::Region_unordered_map = std::unordered_map<Item, std::size_t, internal::hash_item<Item> >
memberdef.name: Region_unordered_map

memberdef.definition: using CGAL::Shape_detection::Point_set::Least_squares_sphere_fit_region< GeomTraits, Item_, PointMap, NormalMap >::Region_index_map = boost::associative_property_map<Region_unordered_map>
memberdef.name: Region_index_map

memberdef.definition: CGAL::Shape_detection::Point_set::Least_squares_sphere_fit_region< GeomTraits, Item_, PointMap, NormalMap >::Least_squares_sphere_fit_region
memberdef.name: Least_squares_sphere_fit_region

parameterdescription.para: a sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: the maximum distance from a point to a sphere
the maximum angle in degrees between the normal of a point and the radius of a sphere
the cos value computed as cos(maximum_angle * PI / 180), this parameter can be used instead of the maximum_angle
the minimum number of 3D points a region must have
the radius below which an estimated sphere is considered as invalid and discarded
the radius above which an estimated sphere is considered as invalid and discarded.
an instance of PointMap that maps an item to Kernel::Point_3
an instance of NormalMap that maps an item to Kernel::Vector_3

memberdef.definition: Region_index_map CGAL::Shape_detection::Point_set::Least_squares_sphere_fit_region< GeomTraits, Item_, PointMap, NormalMap >::region_index_map
memberdef.name: region_index_map

detaileddescription.para: This function creates an empty property map that maps iterators on the input range Item to std::size_t

memberdef.definition: Primitive CGAL::Shape_detection::Point_set::Least_squares_sphere_fit_region< GeomTraits, Item_, PointMap, NormalMap >::primitive
memberdef.name: primitive

detaileddescription.para: This function provides the last primitive that has been fitted with the region.

simplesect.para: Primitive parameters that fits the region

para.computeroutput: fitted primitive via successful call of update(region) with a sufficient large region

memberdef.definition: bool CGAL::Shape_detection::Point_set::Least_squares_sphere_fit_region< GeomTraits, Item_, PointMap, NormalMap >::is_part_of_region
memberdef.name: is_part_of_region

detaileddescription.para: This function controls if a point with the index query_index is within the maximum_distance from the corresponding sphere and if the angle between its normal and the sphere radius is within the maximum_angle. If both conditions are satisfied, it returns true, otherwise false.

memberdef.definition: bool CGAL::Shape_detection::Point_set::Least_squares_sphere_fit_region< GeomTraits, Item_, PointMap, NormalMap >::is_valid_region
memberdef.name: is_valid_region

detaileddescription.para: This function controls if the estimated radius is between minimum_radius and maximum_radius and if the region contains at least min_region_size points.

parameterdescription.para: indices of points included in the region

memberdef.definition: bool CGAL::Shape_detection::Point_set::Least_squares_sphere_fit_region< GeomTraits, Item_, PointMap, NormalMap >::update
memberdef.name: update

detaileddescription.para: This function fits the least squares sphere to all points from the region.

parameterdescription.para: indices of points included in the region

simplesect.para: Boolean true if the sphere fitting succeeded and false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Region type based on the quality of the least squares sphere fit applied to 3D points.

detaileddescription.para: This class fits a sphere to chunks of points in a 3D point set and controls the quality of this fit. If all quality conditions are satisfied, the chunk is accepted as a valid region, otherwise rejected.

parameterdescription.para: a descriptor representing a given point. Must be a model of Hashable.
a model of ReadablePropertyMap whose key type is the value type of the input range and value type is Kernel::Point_3
a model of ReadablePropertyMap whose key type is the value type of the input range and value type is Kernel::Vector_3
